He shows his method for the number 919281. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 427, 850, 528]]<|/det|>
Subtract and add alternately the digits in the number.\(9-1+9-2+8-1=22\)
Check if the answer is a multiple of 11 .\(22=2 \times 11\)
As 22 is a multiple of 11 then 919281 is a multiple of 11 .
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[157, 542, 769, 560]]<|/det|> Show that the number 918271937 is a multiple of 11 by using Zaid's method. <|ref|>question_part<|/ref|><|det|>[[200, 200, 200, 200]]<|/det|> (c) <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[80, 716, 382, 733]]<|/det|> 7 The range of eight numbers is 31 . <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 733, 377, 747]]<|/det|> These are seven of the numbers. <|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[331, 761, 706, 778]]<|/det|> \begin{array}{lllllllll} 28 & 36 & 42 & 24 & 38 & 16 & 21 \end{array} <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 793, 510, 809]]<|/det|> Find the two possible values of the eighth number.
